summary:
## Romulus and Remus: Founders of Rome

Romulus and Remus, twin brothers suckled by a she-wolf, founded the city of Rome around 750 BC. According to myth, Romulus killed Remus and became the first king. The story has been told since at least 300 BC, but we don't know for sure if it's true. The famous Capitoline Wolf statue, showing the twins with the wolf, might be ancient Etruscan or a medieval sculpture.
title: Romulus and Remus
